metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27823 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenJPEGâ€™s encoder. This flaw allows an attacker to pass specially crafted x,y offset input to OpenJPEG to use during encoding. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
texmaker: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
